channel.title: Can someone explain this better?

item.title: Can someone explain this better?
item.dc:creator: @Ixl_Adds_Ixl Ixl Adds Ixl
item.description:
@Ixl_Adds_Ixl wrote:

public static void arraycopy(Object src, int srcPos, Object dest, int destPos, int length)

From Java [size=6pt]TM[/size]
[size=12pt]"[/size][size=8pt]The two Object arguments specify the array to copy from and the array to copy to. The three int arguments specify the starting position in the source array, the starting position in the destination array, and the number of array elements to copy.[/size][size=12pt]"[/size]

wtf? dont get it

heres the code I made using it, but i still get a error

[code=java]class IxlAddsIxl {

    public static void main(String[] args) {

String[][] names = {{"Mr. ", "Mrs. ", "Ms. "},
                    {"iExcel", "Bitcher"}};
char[] copyFrom = {'-','J','a','r','o','d','i','s',
                   't','h','e','s','h','i','t'};
char[] copyTo = new char[13];

System.out.println(names[0][0]+names[1][0]+" wants to fuck");
System.out.println("but "+names[0][2]+names[1][1]+" doesn't");
System.out.println("Soooo... Who will fuck?");
System.out.println(names.length);
System.arraycopy(copyFrom, 0, copyTo, 1, 14);
System.out.println(new String(copyTo));

}[/code]

Idk, but i think it has something to do with the arraycopy() method

Read full topic
